p: Several studies also revealed a stimulating effect of salinity on ascorbic acid in tomato fruits [ 22]. Sgherri et al. [ 37] explained an increase in ascorbic acid content in tomato under salinity stress with a de novo synthesis beside an enhanced ascorbate recycling via recycling enzymes coupled with the reducing compound dihydrolipoic acid. A stimulating effect of different environmental stresses has been demonstrated also on tocopherol (vitamin E) content of tomato fruits [ 38].
